results.content:
Unbelievably bad. Starts off painfully slow, we're expected to watch the teacher keep changing directories... he makes lots of mistakes very frequently, and we patiently are expected to follow misspellings and painful syntax errors hat he then needs to debug. At other times (later sections in the course), he takes a very complicated yet fundamental Elixir concept and flies through it so fast and superficially that w don't even have time to read what's on the screen. 

Also terrible: he heavy Indian accent is difficult to understand, compounded by the fact that the audio is almost as bad as it could possibly be. Sometimes so quiet and bad that we can't understand the words at all. Often in the background there are people coming in and out of the room, background noise, etc. 

Totally regret signing up for this "course" :(
results.content_html:

Starts off painfully slow, we're expected to watch the teacher keep changing directories... he makes lots of mistakes very frequently, and we patiently are expected to follow misspellings and painful syntax errors hat he then needs to debug. At other times (later sections in the course), he takes a very complicated yet fundamental Elixir concept and flies through it so fast and superficially that w don't even have time to read what's on the screen.

Also terrible: he heavy Indian accent is difficult to understand, compounded by the fact that the audio is almost as bad as it could possibly be. Sometimes so quiet and bad that we can't understand the words at all. Often in the background there are people coming in and out of the room, background noise, etc.

Totally regret signing up for this "course" :(

results.content: Almost 90% of information in only in slides, he only limits to read the slide.  Also, when he talks he uses the mouse pointer to point the element what he talks but it is wrong. For example, he talks about LIST or TUPLE but he points to ATOMS, that is confused why he uses the pointer. Finally, the way he recorded the video shows apparently he uses a tutorial near him, because for a very very simple "hello world" example he needs to fix and pause the video sequence
results.content_html: Almost 90% of information in only in slides, he only limits to read the slide. Also, when he talks he uses the mouse pointer to point the element what he talks but it is wrong. For example, he talks about LIST or TUPLE but he points to ATOMS, that is confused why he uses the pointer. Finally, the way he recorded the video shows apparently he uses a tutorial near him, because for a very very simple "hello world" example he needs to fix and pause the video sequence

results.content:
Instructor seems to be an expert on Elixir programming although his accent could be a minor problem to few at starting videos but there is no difficulty in learning. 
Concepts are well explained and easy to implement.
Visuals are good, with nice infographic content.

results.content:
This is a detailed course covering almost every aspect of elixir coding.
Pros: Each topic is well explained with demonstrations and codes.
  One of the trending programming language.
Accent is good and easy to understand.

Cons: You have to learn other web technologies like database, etc to build your application.
results.content_html:

Cons: You have to learn other web technologies like database, etc to build your application.
